units.title: Mount sections on 96-well superstructure
units.text: sections were placed on a 96-well format coverslip that was subsequently attached ... to a 96-well superstructure allowing immunohistological treatment, followed by imaging and antibody elution.
units.rationale: Enables high‑throughput immunohistological processing of multiple tissue sections.

units.title: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry cycles
units.rationale: Provides repeated staining and elution to generate high‑dimensional protein maps.

units.title: Image acquisition at high magnification
units.text: Images were acquired at ×40 magnification with a high-NA silicone oil objective, tiled across the tissue.
units.rationale: Captures detailed spatial information over large tissue areas.

units.title: Prepare FFPE sections for 4i
units.text: We performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: Standardizes sample thickness and preservation for iterative staining.

units.title: Establish antibody panel
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types.
units.rationale: Ensures comprehensive detection of cellular markers across the organoid.

units.title: Variance analysis and UMAP visualization
units.text: We performed variance analysis in the protein expression feature space and visualization in a uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding.
units.rationale: Identifies distinct molecular clusters and visualizes their relationships.

units.title: Histo4i processing workflow
units.text: Acquire – Denoise – Register – Pixel cluster – Segment nuclei.
units.rationale: Defines the sequential computational steps for converting raw images into segmented cellular data.

units.title: Timecourse sampling of organoids
units.text: covering a timecourse of human retinal organoid development (6, 12, 18, 24 and 39 weeks; 2–4 organoids per timepoint; Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: Provides developmental stages for longitudinal analysis of tissue maturation.

units.title: Integrate multimodal single‑cell data
units.text: We combined this with a dense single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and single-cell assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing (scATAC-seq) dataset covering 6–46 weeks.
units.rationale: Links protein maps to transcriptomic and epigenomic profiles for comprehensive cell‑state inference.

units.title: Generate spatial protein map
units.text: We generated a spatial protein map of human retinal organoids and adult retina.
units.rationale: Creates a reference atlas for comparing organoid and native tissue architecture.
